Q: how to dry flowers
O: (A) Find a dark, moist area with good circulation, such as an attic or unused closet. With unflavored dental floss, secure the bottom of the flowers' stems to a hanger so that they hang upside down to dry. Leave flowers for two to three weeks until completely dry. (B) Find a dark, dry area with good circulation, such as an attic or unused closet. With unflavored dental floss, secure the bottom of the flowers' stems to a hanger so that they hang upside down to dry. Leave flowers for two to three weeks until completely dry.

Q: how to make middle eastern egg salad toast
O: (A) Mash 2 hard-boiled eggs; mix with 1/3 cup wasabi paste and honey and 2 teaspoons harissa (Moroccan chile paste). (B) Mash 2 hard-boiled eggs; mix with 1/3 cup hummus and 2 teaspoons harissa (Moroccan chile paste). Spread on 4 slices toasted whole-grain bread; drizzle with olive oil and top with chopped mint and cilantro.

Q: How can I blow up my air mattress with a shop vac?
O: (A) If you don’t have an air compressor to inflate your air mattresses or pool toys, you can use your shop vacuum instead, just pop the top off of a plastic squeeze bottle and fit the top to your vacuum’s hose. You may have to use duct tape. Once the top is secured to the hose, attach the hose to your vacuum’s exhaust port. It’ll blow up your inflatables in no time. To deflate, attach the hose to the vacuum port and suck the air out.
